data.title: Patrick J. Buchanan Weds Shelley Scarney
data.meta_description: Buchanan weds S Scarney; Pres and Mrs Nixon and daughters Julie and Patricia attend; illus
data.text:
WASHINGTON, May 8— Miss Shelley Scarney, a White House receptionist, was married here this afternoon to Patrick J. Buchanan, special assistant to President Nixon and Presidential speechwriter. The nuptial mass, at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament, was performed by Msgr. W. Louis Quinn before 400 guests, including Washington officials.

President Nixon, who hired the 32‐year‐old bridegroom as an executive assistant when Mr. Nixon began his political comeback in 1966, and who has known the bride since l959, was also at the wedding. With him was Mrs. Nixon, their daughters, Mrs. Julie Nixon Eisenhower, and her husband, David, and Tricia, who will he married at the White House on June 12.

The President and Mrs. Nixon posed with the couple outside the church, protected from a light rain by a large umbrella. Mrs. Nixon wore a deep pink linen dress with a jacket trimmed in a band of white and pink embroidery.

Miss Nixon wore a white pique dress with matching jacket trimmed with coral beadwork and her sister wore a mint green brocade dress. David Eisenhower escorted his wife and sister‐in‐law to a reception at the Washington Club.

Among the guests were Attorney General and Mrs. John N. Mitchell, Mr. and Mrs. Ronald Zeigler and Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Klein. The President and his family sat on the bride's side in the second pew near the aisle.

The bride's parents are Dr. and Mrs. Herman Scarney of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. The bridegroom's parrents are Mr. and Mrs. Wil Liam B. Buchanan of Washington, Dr. Scarney is an ophthalmologist. Mr. Buchanan is a partner in the accounting firm of Councilor, Buchanan & Mitchell.

The bride's classic silk satin dress, with Empire bodice of delicately embroidered Brussels lace, was bordered with matching lace. With it, she wore a French silk mantilla of illusion appliquéd with Brussels lace. She carried an Edwardian bouquet of tips of stock, white roses and hydrangeas.

Mrs. John Gordon Boyd of Washington, was matron of honor. The other attendants were Mrs. John Connolly of Portland, Me., Miss Angela Buchanan of Washington—both sisters of the bridegroom — and Miss Cynthia Brumback, receptionist in the White House Visitors Office. Dr. James Buchanan of Washington was his brother's best man.

Mrs. Buchanan, a graduate of Kingswood School Cranbrook in Bloomfield Hills and the University of Michigan, joined Mr. Nixon's staff when he was Vice President, and later worked for him in his New York law firm.
